summary: Email correspondence between prosecutors and defense attorneys in US v. Maxwell regarding discovery issues, specifically problems accessing and viewing photographic and video evidence, including disputes over the classification and handling of 'Highly Confidential' nude/sexualized images and discrepancies in the number of such images reported.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Partner at Haddon, Morgan & Foreman, P.C., representing Ghislaine Maxwell. She is corresponding with prosecutors about significant deficiencies in the production of discovery, particularly regarding access to photographic and video evidence.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence regarding discovery issues in US v. Maxwell, presumably part of Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence regarding discovery issues in US v. Maxwell, presumably part of Maxwell's defense team. Email address noted as besternheim@mac.com.

connections.description: Both are defense attorneys copied on the same correspondence regarding discovery issues for Ghislaine Maxwell.
Both are defense attorneys copied on the same correspondence regarding discovery issues for Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Scheduled Trial Date for US v. Maxwell
events.description: The document references November 29, 2021, as the scheduled trial date for the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Defense Review of Evidence in New York
events.description: The week of April 13, 2021, defense counsel met in New York to review evidence in the government's possession, including 'highly confidential' material on hard drives.

events.title: FBI Report on HC Images and Videos
events.description: An FBI report dated January 27, 2021, indicated approximately 33,747 Highly Confidential images and 895 HC videos were identified from a digital review of CART-processed evidence from Epstein's devices.

locations: Denver, CO 80203 (Haddon, Morgan & Foreman, P.C. office)
500 Pearl (presumably a government office location in NY where evidence was reviewed)
MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center, where Ghislaine Maxwell was held)
keyFacts: Defense attorneys report major discovery deficiencies, including thousands of unreadable photo files, corrupt Excel spreadsheets, and an inability to match metadata to specific Bates-stamped files.

A significant discrepancy exists regarding the number of 'Highly Confidential' nude/sexualized images: prosecutors initially cited ~2,100 from Epstein's devices, but an FBI report indicates ~33,747 HC images and 895 HC videos.

The government defines 'Highly Confidential' material as containing "nude, partially-nude, or otherwise sexualized images, videos, or other depictions of individuals" and restricts defense access, requiring review under law enforcement supervision.

Defense counsel argues that among the HC material they reviewed, there were nude photos of adults but nothing they identified as child pornography, and they request copies of all HC material minus any CP for proper trial preparation.
The correspondence shows ongoing tension over the defense's constitutional right to review all discovery versus the government's security concerns over sensitive imagery.
